name: Kanchipuram Pure Silk Saree
description: Handwoven pure silk saree with traditional temple border and gold zari work. This masterpiece takes 15-20 days to weave.
culturalBackground: Kanchipuram silk weaving has been a tradition for over 400 years. The silk is sourced from Karnataka and the zari from Gujarat, representing India's cultural unity.

name: Thanjavur Dancing Doll
description: Traditional bobblehead doll made of terracotta with hand-painted details. These dolls never fall due to their unique center of gravity design.
culturalBackground: Dating back to the Maratha period in Thanjavur, these dolls symbolize resilience and balance. They were originally made for royal families.

name: Tanjore Painting
description: Traditional Tanjore painting with gold foil work depicting Lord Krishna. Hand-painted on wooden board with semi-precious stones.
culturalBackground: Tanjore paintings originated in Thanjavur during the Chola dynasty. They are known for their rich colors, gold foil, and embellishments with precious stones.

name: Bronze Nataraja Statue
description: Hand-crafted bronze statue of Lord Nataraja using the traditional lost-wax casting method. Height: 12 inches.
culturalBackground: Bronze sculptures have been crafted in Tamil Nadu since the Chola period (9th-13th century). Nataraja represents the cosmic dance of creation and destruction.

name: Chettinad Cotton Saree
description: Handwoven cotton saree with traditional Chettinad patterns in vibrant colors. Perfect for daily wear and temple visits.
culturalBackground: Chettinad cotton weaving is known for its bold patterns and vibrant colors, reflecting the rich merchant culture of the Chettiar community.

name: Pattamadai Palm Leaf Mat
description: Handwoven mat made from dried palm leaves with intricate patterns. Eco-friendly and naturally cooling.
culturalBackground: Pattamadai mats have been woven for over 200 years. They were traditionally used by royal families and are known for their fine quality.

name: Madurai Sungudi Fabric
description: Traditional tie-and-dye cotton fabric in vibrant colors. Known for its durability and unique patterns.
culturalBackground: Sungudi is a 300-year-old art form from Madurai. The natural dyes and tie-dye technique create unique patterns on cotton fabric.

name: Temple Jewelry Set
description: Traditional temple jewelry necklace set with antique gold finish. Inspired by temple architecture and deities.
culturalBackground: Temple jewelry was originally worn by temple dancers (Devadasis). The designs are inspired by South Indian temple architecture.

name: Tirunelveli Wheat Halwa
description: Authentic Tirunelveli halwa made with pure ghee, wheat, and cashews. Packed in traditional containers.
culturalBackground: This recipe dates back over 100 years and uses water from the Thamirabarani river, giving it a unique taste.

name: Bhavani Jamakalam Carpet
description: Handwoven cotton carpet with traditional geometric patterns. Size: 6x4 feet. Durable and machine washable.
culturalBackground: Bhavani has been weaving Jamakalam for over 400 years. These carpets were used in royal palaces and are known for their durability.
